alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:16AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, southeastern Putnam, southwestern Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 316 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Institute, or near Nitro, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Poca, Cross Lanes, Institute, Tornado, Alum Creek, Teays Valley and Liberty. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 101 and 124. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 43 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 70 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots.
